alerts.afterSave: The changes in this area become active after a restart.
alerts.afterSaveOrManualStart: The changes in this area become active after a restart or after the measurements have been stopped and started again with the button. Whether the WittyPi runs in the energy-saving schedule is decided in the measuring routine, if the battery voltage was measured.
alerts.deviceId: Note: A sensor with an invalid device ID was detected. This occurs with the DS18B20, for example, if a resistor is forgotten or an incorrect resistor is used. Another cause could be a connected DHT sensor. In this case this message can be ignored.
alerts.dummyload: Dummyload is a function of the WittyPis to keep a Powerbank active. Some Powerbank models tend to switch off when no power is used for a longer period of time. To save battery power the dummyload should remain deactivated as long as no powerbank is used.
alerts.errorSaving: Error! The settings could not be saved.
alerts.gpio: GPIO: The contact pins on the Raspberry Pi Board have two numberings. One physical from 1 to 40 and one for each freely programmable GPIO. Here in maintenance mode is always the GPIO numbering beeing used.

hx711.offset:
Offset: Influences the measuring result by subtracting the offset from the measured value.
Can also be a negative number. Indication in grams. Default is "0".
hx711.offset2: Can also be a negative number. Indication in grams. Default is "0". Changed automatically during maintenance mode. Any weight change in maintenance mode is automatoically measured and this value will be updated.
hx711.scale:
Scaling value: Influences the measurement result by dividing (measured value-offset) by the scaling value.
Four decimal places are allowed and the decimal places are separated by a dot and not by a comma. The default is "1".

alerts.noTempSensorFound: No temperature sensor could be found on the device.
alerts.notAP: Note: The maintenance mode is not called via the "HoneyPi" AccessPoint. Therefore, pressing the hardware button will probably remain off. However, changes can be applied by clicking the following button:
alerts.shutdownAfterTransfer: To enter the maintenance mode, the button must be pressed immediately after the LED flashes at startup.
alerts.tomanysensorsofthattype: Some sensors, including BH1750, PA1010D and EE895 can only be connected to the Raspberry Pi once via I2C bus. The sensors BME280 and BME680 can be connected at most twice due to the limited number of I2C addresses. Delete the duplicate entries of these sensors.
alerts.updateAP: Note: The maintenance mode is called by you via the "HoneyPi"-AccessPoint. You can enter a WLAN network of your choice in the "Internet connection" tab. Depending on the Raspberry model a ethernet cable can be connected for internet conmnection.
alerts.updateInfo:
1. The data volume of the surf stick can be used up.
2. It is therefore recommended to disconnect the Raspberry Pi from the Surfstick for the system update and connect it to an existing WiFi network.
alerts.updateNotAP: Success! You call the Raspberry not via the "HoneyPi" AccessPoint, but via the IP address in the home network.
alerts.wittypi: With the help of the additional Witty Pi module, the Raspberry Pi can be time-controlled. We already offer three useful schedule programs. These can also be changed in the input field. Prerequisite is the WittyPi module. When saving, there should be an "Internet connection" (e.g. via a surfstick or WiFi) so that the current system time can be updated.

error.length: "{{field}}" is outside the valid value range.
error.spaces: "{{field}}" contains a space character. Is that wanted?
error.wittypiinstructions: A schedule on the WittyPi module has been activated, set the measurement interval to "once after power on" and activate "shutdown after successful transfer".
error.wittypinotwait: The Raspberry shutsdown after successful measurement transmission. Therefore your schedule should be adjusted. At the end of each "ON" line there should be a "WAIT". A missing "WAIT" after the e.g. "ON M5" would cause the WittyPi module to start up the Raspberry again for shutdown.
error.wittypiwait: Enable "Shutdown after successful transfer", by the existing "WAIT" behind the "ON" line the Raspberry will not be shutdown by the WittyPi module.
error.wittypiyeartobig: The duration of your WittyPi schedule is too long. Change the year to 2037 at most.

confirm.installWittyPi:
NOTE: This installation is no longer necessary and the WittyPi should also work without installation. 

You are about to install the software for the WittyPi module on your HoneyPi. For this an internet connection (e.g. via WiFi) must be available. Please test this first in the tab "Test Internet connection". Also don't forget to save your current settings first.
confirm.reboot:
All unsaved changes are lost. The connection will be temporarily disconnected. 
The device will now restart.  
Are you sure?
confirm.restart:
If the maintenance mode should be active, it will be terminated and the measurements will start. With an activated WittyPi schedule, the Raspberry may shut down after successful measurement data transfer.  
Continue?
confirm.savedAP:
A restart is required for the most changes to take effect. 
Should the device now be restarted?
confirm.shutdown:
All unsaved changes are lost. The device will now shutdown. 
Are you sure?
confirm.start:
If the maintenance mode should be active, it will be terminated and the measurements will start. With an activated WittyPi schedule, the Raspberry may shut down after successful measurement data transfer.  
Continue?
confirm.stop:
The HoneyPi service is stopped. It does not restart itself, so do not forget to restart the service!  
Continue?

connectionerror.body: The beehive scale is currently not available, probably the system has been restarted, this can take up to 1 minute.
connectionerror.stayconnectedAP: Another reason could be: Please make sure you are still connected to the HoneyPi WiFi. The connection may have disconnected automatically in the meantime. Since the "HoneyPi" access point does not provide an Internet connection, devices tend to use mobile networks for the Internet, even though they have WiFi connected. To be stil able to connect to the HoneyPi web interface it might help: Activate flight mode and then activate only the WiFi. Connect to the "HoneyPi" access point again.
connectionerror.stayconnectedNotAP: Obviously you do not seem to call up the HoneyPi via the access point. Another reason could be that the IP address of the device in your home network has changed. You could also try to clear the browser cache to see if this is causing the issue.
connectionerror.title: Connection failed

internet.collapseAP: Advanced settings for users who know what they're doing »
internet.connect: Choose the type of your internet modem. Any connection problems that occur can thus be correctly noted in the log.
internet.connectHiLink: Connect surfstick in HiLink mode (most used)
internet.connectSelect: Choose the type of your internet modem...
internet.connectWifi: Connect to existing WiFi network when reachable?
internet.honeypiAPtext: Change the SSID and password of the AccessPoint.
internet.infoConnection: During the maintenance mode the Raspi can not simultaneously be connected to a WiFi network, since the WiFi chip already provides the access point. Therefore, only the Internet connection of a connected surf stick or the LAN connection can be tested.
internet.testSuccess: HoneyPi is connected! The internet test was successful.
internet.title: Internet connection

log.empty: The log on this device is empty.
log.nofile: There is no log on this device.
log.title: Log

measurement.construction: This view is only provisional so far and will be extended in the next firmware version.
measurement.info: The sensors configured and stored in the "{{tab}}" tab are displayed here. There is no upload of measurement data to ThingSpeak. Measurement takes up to 1 minute.
measurement.noData: No measurement data measured. Were the sensors configured in the "{{tab}}" tab?
measurement.title: Measurement data

miscellaneous.display_enabled: Enable OLED (Model: OLED 128x64px with SSD1306 Chip)
miscellaneous.enable_reset: Enable the option that when the button is pressed for 10 seconds, all HoneyPi settings are reset
miscellaneous.timeToStopMaintenance: The maintenance mode of the HoneyPi Access-Point automatically turns off to correct accidental activations or forgotton switch offs and continue normal measurement operations.
miscellaneous.title: Miscellaneous

offline.infoExport: The measurement data is stored in a CSV file. This file can then be imported into the ThingSpeak Channel. Otherwise, the measurement data can also be visualized with the iOS/Web app.
offline.noData: Specify at least one channel in the tab "{{tab}}".
offline.radio0: Online: Transfer exclusively online to ThingSpeak
offline.radio1: Both: Transfer to ThingSpeak and save to CSV file
offline.radio2: Errors: Write to CSV file only for Internet connection errors
offline.radio3: Offline: Write only offline to CSV file
offline.title: Offline Measurement data

calibration.step0: Start the automatic calibration of the scale.
calibration.step1:
Remove all weights from the scale and ensure that the measurement is not disturbed by touching the scale.
Then press Next.
calibration.step2:
Only place your calibration weight on the scale. The weight should be at least 3000g (3kg).
Enter the weight of the calibration weight used [in grams]. Then press Next.
calibration.step3: Calibration is completed. Do not forget to save the new settings.
calibration.title: Calibration of the scale

sensors.checkWires: Please check the wires of the connected sensors and
sensors.debug: Enable debug mode <small>(no restarts, HDMI output on, successful transfers in the protocol)</small>
sensors.debugSelectLogfile: Select the type and amount of output to the log file.
sensors.dummyload: Activate dummyload (only use together with a Powerbank)
sensors.dummyloadTimespan: Time duration of the dummy load
sensors.enableCompensation: Temperature compensation for temperature-induced measurement drifts
sensors.filter_negative: Filter negative values to reduce measurement errors
sensors.i2c_addr:
I2C-Address
only required if more than one sensor is connected.
sensors.measurementOnce: One-time transfer after power-on (suggested for WittyPi module)
sensors.shutdownAfterTransfer: Shut down Raspberry after single transfer
sensors.title: Attached sensors
sensors.use3V: Using a GPIO as 3.3V power supply source

thingspeak.confirmCheck:
You are about to test if the ThingSpeak connection information you entered is correct.
Note: This function only works if the Raspberry Pi is connected to the Internet. To check the Internet connection, click on the tab and the button "Check Internet Connection".

update.newVersionAvailable: A more recent system update is available. You can update this in the "System update" tab. Keep your HoneyPi software up to date to benefit from bug fixes and new features.
